week3

Class Indexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • week3.Indexer

  • public class Indexer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class indexes all files in a given folder under the assumption that they are all text files. To avoid the indexing of a file, its name has to begin with '.'. The class doesn't store a secondary index to keep track of the names of the files, but this can be easily implemented. (It is not done because the corpus's files are all numerically identified).
    Author:
    Luiz Felix

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Indexer(java.lang.String path)
      Indexes all files from a given folder that are not hidden.

      Returns a list with the ID of all the documents that contains all the terms on words.
      java.lang.String notQuery(java.lang.String[] words)
      Returns a list with the ID of all the documents that match ONLY the first element on words.
      java.lang.String orQuery(java.lang.String[] words)
      Returns a list with the ID of all the documents that contains at least one term on words.
      java.lang.String simpleQuery(java.lang.String word)
      Returns a list with the ID of the documents that contains the term word.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Indexer

        public Indexer(java.lang.String path)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Indexes all files from a given folder that are not hidden. 
        All the files on this folder must be text otherwise must be hidden.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the folder to be indexed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO fault occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • simpleQuery

        public java.lang.String simpleQuery(java.lang.String word)
                             throws IndexerException
        Returns a list with the ID of the documents that contains the term word. This method is case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        word - The word to be searched on all files.
        Returns:
        A String with the ID of each matched document. If none is found, null is returned.
        Throws:
        IndexerException - if the query is an empty string or null.

      • andQuery

        public java.lang.String andQuery(java.lang.String[] words)
                          throws IndexerException
        Returns a list with the ID of all the documents that contains all the terms on words.
        Parameters:
        words - The words to be queried.
        Returns:
        A String with the ID of each matched document. If none is found, null is returned.
        Throws:
        IndexerException - if any element of the query is an empty string or null.

      • orQuery

        public java.lang.String orQuery(java.lang.String[] words)
                         throws IndexerException
        Returns a list with the ID of all the documents that contains at least one term on words.
        Parameters:
        words - The words to be queried.
        Returns:
        A String with the ID of each matched document. If none is found, null is returned.
        Throws:
        IndexerException - if any element of the query is an empty string or null.

      • notQuery

        public java.lang.String notQuery(java.lang.String[] words)
                          throws IndexerException
        Returns a list with the ID of all the documents that match ONLY the first element on words.
        Parameters:
        words - The words to be queried.
        Returns:
        A String with the ID of each matched document. If none is found, null is returned.
        Throws:
        IndexerException - if any element of the query is an empty string or null.
